newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Details of Russian ADR issues and plans.
newsitem.headline: Details of Russian ADR issues and plans.

text.p: Following are details of depositary receipts issued by Russian companies or planned in the future.
(Source Reuters, Bank of New York, Salomon Brothers): LAUNCHED
UES - May 12, 1997. Global Depositary Receipt (GDR). Regulation S. One GDR covers 100 ordinary shares. The GDRs will trade on London SEAQ and shortly on Berlin Stock Exchange.
LUKoil pref - Feb 12, 1997. American Depositary Receipts. Level-1. One ADR covers two underlying preferred shares.
Irkutskenergo - Jan 23, 1997. American Depositary Receipt. Level-1. One ADR covers 50 underlying shares.
Bank Menatep - Q1, 1997, American Depositary Receipt. Level-1
Surgutneftegaz - Dec 30, 1996. American Depositary Receipt. Level-1. One ADR covers 50 ordinary shares.

Tatneft - Nov 29, 1996. Private placement of 10 percent of company capital or 2.33 million shares at $45 a share. American Depositary Receipts. 144A, Regulation S. Overallotment brought total offer to 2.7 million ADR. One ADR covers one share. June 3, 1996. American Depositary Receipts. Level-1.
Gazprom - Oct 24, 1996. American Depositary Shares. 144A, Regulation S. One ADS covers 10 underlying shares. Raised $430 million on 27.3 million shares.
Vimpelcom - Nov 20, 1996. American Depositary Receipts. Level-3. (ADRs issued before shares traded in Russia).
Bank Vozrozhdeniye - July 3, 1996. American Depositary Receipt. Level-1.
GUM - June 7, 1996. American Depositary Receipts. 144A, Regulation S.
Inkombank - May 28, 1996. American Depositary Receipt. Level-1. One ADR covers 15 underlying shares.
Chernogorneft - March 22, 1996. American Depositary Receipt. Level-1. 17.1 pct of shares in ADR form as of Oct 1, 1996.
Seversky Trubny Zavod - Feb 5, 1996. American Depositary Receipt. Level-1.

LUKoil ordinaries - Dec 31, 1995, Mar 14, 1996. American Depositary Receipts. Level-1, 144A. One level-1 ADR covers four underlying ordinary shares. 460,000 convertible bonds were converted into 78.2 million shares.
Mosenergo - Oct 13, 1995 American Depositary Receipt. 144A, Regulation S. Private placement.
PLANNED
Aeroflot - planning level-one ADR
Chernogorneft - considering issuing a level-three ADR to be listed on New York Stock Exchange
Gazprom - plans another international issue after April 1997

LUKoil - plans 15 percent stake of government-owned stock to non-strategic investors in form of level-three ADRs in 1997 or Q1 1998. Also plans level-one GDRs on underlying ordinary shares listing in London
Megionneftegaz - planning level-one ADR
Mosenergo - plans level-one ADR in 1997. Exemption received in November 1996, documents sent at end of April 1997. Salomon Bros says level-three ADRs also planned
Neftekhimbank - planning ADR
Nizhny Novgorod Svyazinform - planning ADR
Norilsk Nickel - plans level-one ADRs
Purneftegaz - was planning level-one ADR but announced end of April 1997 it dropped plans because of planned unified Rosneft share
Rostelekom - said at beginning of April 1997 it may issue level-two or level-three ADRs in 1997
Samara Svyazinform - planning ADR
Surgutneftegaz - plans ADRs on preferred shares
Sverdlovenergo - plans to convert up to 26 percent of shares held by foreign ivestors to level-one ADRs by end of 1997.

Tatneft - mulling level-three ADR issue since announced plans on Sept 25 1996. Accounts for 1994 and 1995 audited to international standards, waiting for 1996 results. Bankers said could be just trying to raise capital through private placement of ADR or level-two issue
TsUM - granted 12g3-2b exemption end of April 1997, plans level-one ADR issue this year
Tyumentelekom - board of directors voted in early April 1997 to issue level-one ADRs and is considering using a 10 percent stake controlled by company for the issue
UES - ADRs planned in summer 1997
Uralmash - ADRs planned by end 1997 or early 1998 in a $30-35 million private placement of new shares which would convert to level one ADRs
Uralsvyazinform - planning level-one ADR issue for early 1997
YUKOS - planning level-one ADRs
